She said: Oh!  You know I forgotten your name, my name is Elizabeth.  So we reintroduced ourselves.  (That was her very clever way of getting our names.) At the end of the meal, she brought each of us a dinner plate with our name and Happy 44th Anniversary written out in chocolate with a little sunday in the middle with a candle! You just don't get any kinder than that!!! She made a memory for us that will never forget.   THANK YOU,  ELIZABETH!!!!!  (And Cheesecake Factory for hiring great people like this.)

Hoity Toity foodies step off, I don't care for your attitude or your holy than thou prescribed bias on food and chain restaurants.  I care about how the food tastes, I could care less if it came out of a shack cooked by a homeless person on Santa Monica Blvd. GLAM BURGER? REALLY CHEESECAKE? REALLY? If I didn't like this place I'd have some snide comment. Has anyone tried their Farmhouse Burger?  It is effing awesome!  Medium Rare Kobe with smoked and grilled pork belly with a sunny side egg and I asked for a Garlic Aoili on it with spinach and pepper Jack...Sounds Good huh?  It was awesome!  I get the sweet potato fries with the chipotle dipping sauce because I can.  BOMB. Dot. COm! The chicken Madeira is a favorite of mine.  As well as the "Philly" cheesesteak, its not authenitc but its pretty delish.  I also like that they have Heifenweizen on tap!   The last time I went the chubby waitress was kinda bitchy to my friend.  I didn't really appreciate it, but the food was still good and since I was a bit drunk I didn't really care.  But other than that instance, I've gotten pretty good service here.
Food was good and the service was excellent. I like that they are attentive. I never had to ask for a refill of our drinks.

Very irritated. I called to place an order for two cheesecakes and they put me on hold for twenty minutes! I don't know why I waited that long I guess they were waiting for me to hang up. they finally answered 5 minutes before they closed and sounded very irritated by repeatedly saying "you can place your order only if you come before 11" How am I supposed to get there in 5 minutes? I understand coming in 5 minutes to get an order can be annoying but I called in 20 minutes before and i'm pretty certain they made me wait that long so I could give up and hang up.

Okay..I've eaten at several of these chains and am only speaking about this specific Cheesecake Factory.  Previous to my most recent visit, I have dined at this specific restaurant four or five times without any issues. My cousin and I met up for a dinner during the week. Since it wasn't a weekend, the wait was less than five minutes (yay!).  We were seated in the area near the kitchen which are "booths" only one person wide.   While waiting for our meal to come out, I thought I saw something crawling on the side of the wall.  It was hard to tell since the lighting is dim and the walls are dark, so we both disregarded it and continued to talk.  When our meals came out we had no complaints.  I had a chicken dish (I can't remember what).  Halfway through our meal we BOTH saw something crawling on the wall, but we were unable to kill it.  A few minutes later, a bug (which looked like a baby roach!) crawled across her bread plate!  She killed it with her napkin and we promptly called the manager.  He comped our meals and asked us if we wanted dessert (really?)! We were only halfway through eating...we tipped and left sans dessert because of how disgusted we were. I liked dining here previous to this experience.  The bug probably came from the dark paneled walls...but just seeing it crawl across a plate is a strong enough memory to keep me away from here for good.

I will start this off my saying that I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory. On average the establishment is clean and and the food is satisfying.  The Cheesecake Factory is Thousand Oaks is BELOW normal Cheesecake Factory standards and below most roach coach standards. On a recent visit I observed a bus boy wipe a nearby table off and then proceeded to wipe the booth off as well. Then the bus boy took the same rag and re-wiped the top of the table off with it! Very disappointing. Throughout the meal the bus boys walked by with their rags with stunk with the smell of cleaner and bleach. I thought it was just myself who noticed this but it soon became a table topic as everyone was able to smell the odors. If you want the Cheesecake Factory its worth the extra drive to find another location.

The customer service is always fantastic and the food is great! I've gone here twice, each time with a different waiter and they never seem to disappoint! Definitely the best service I've ever received at a restaurant. I recommend trying to strawberry shortcake, it's delicious. Definitely coming back.
I been here only two times, but I gots to say the food was amazing. Its a pricey but its worth it. First vist I got the chicken madeira, and 2nd vist was the spicy chipotle pasta. The bomb!!!

the place is awesome! they just get too busy and you get  lost in the craziness. but they have an awesome variety and the food is always going to be delicious. they have the most amazing kobe beef burger. ever. ever ever.

Came here for my dad's birthday lunch on a Sunday. It was very crowded and the line for seating was extremely long (on a Sunday afternoon? Very interesting). I was put down on the waitlist for 5 people, and the girl told me it would be around a 20-25 minute wait. It actually was more like a 2 minute wait, which was awesome for us!  We were seated promptly and given our bread and drinks very quickly. The sourdough bread at Cheesecake is always blah (especially compared to the sourdough I am used to eating at Boudin), but I always love me some good squaw bread. Yumm. Our server was insanely nice and friendly. He made us all feel really welcome and happy.  The reason I am giving this place a 3-star review is the food -- although (as always) large in size, colorful, and beautiful, it simply is not that exciting and delicious to a foodie that's used to scrumptious mom-and-pop restaurant food. We got buffalo wings with blue cheese dressing, 2 different salads, and 2 pasta dishes. They were all ok, but for what we got, definitely not worth the $90 price tag!!  We had a nice time at Cheesecake for a birthday lunch, but I need to remind my sister to stop suggesting Cheesecake Factory for family get-togethers if we want tastebud-tingling food on special occasions.
I like this place especially the cakes:) the service I find is good I enjoyed it def will b e nback

I am writing this review for one reason...   the macaroni and cheese hamburger!!  The genius who came up with this simple, unique creation should be given the culinary equivalent of a Nobel Peace Prize!   To say blending mac n cheese with a hamburger is akin to the first time chocolate and peanut butter were put together is not any sort of crazy exaggeration. BRAVO Cheesecake Factory!!!
I ordered to go and it was ready very fast! Very nice feeling . Live the location. The food is just great!

I love this place. The staff is always friendly and whenever I come on my lunch break the service is always fast and efficient. The only thing that keeps me from putting five stars is that they wouldn't let me make a reservation for my birthday.
Hands down the best Happy Hour for your money!  Delicious $5 appetizers (that look more like a meal) and $5 cocktails.  Can't beat it!

My girlfriend and I come to cheesecake factory quite often. Id say once a week because we love the food and the service. I have to say the past couple times we have been lucky enough to be served by Luca (I believe that is the correct spelling of his name). Luca is a great server. Everything is on point even the simple things like water refills being done, being courteous and just being a really good guy. Hope he is at cheesecake for a while because he is great. Thanks Luca!

Love the cheese cakes and love this Cheesecake Factory. Visiting So. Cal with mom last week, stop by The Oaks for shop and lunch. Service was professional great compared to bay area Cheesecake F. I means all about server, he knows what customer favorite. Most server don't know what I'm thinking but he does!!! Chicken dishes were absolute delicious, initially not willing to choose because I'm not chicken person. Must go!
Usually I love this place but the last time my husband and i were here my salmon was under cooked :(

I love this restaurant the food is great and the price is just right.  The employees are great and offer one of the best customer services around.  The employees really go out of their way to make sure that your needs are met.  I have never had a bad experience ever.

Love this place! My wife I have eaten here several times and the service is top notch!  The food is always fresh and taste fantastic! Today we had lunch here and Elizabeth was the best service we have ever had at any restaurant!  We felt like we here in a 10 star place. Elizabeth is the best server we have ever had. This is a true testimony to her and, the manager makes this place click like clock work. The vibe is fantastic! If you go ask for Elizabeth. I promise you will not be disappointed.

It's The Cheesecake Factory, not many choices outside of the food court when you're at the The Oaks mall so this is where people end up and it is normally always busy on the weekends. Service honestly is a hit or miss, everything from excellent to so terrible I want to report the person to corporate headquarters. Don't order anything weird, stick to the basics. Their menu is so big that they can't possible make everything perfect. Pasta, pizza, burgers and sandwiches are good choices. When I'm here with my friends we LOVE their tuxedo cheesecake, definitely a favorite.  I'm happy that there are more alternatives to sit down places at the mall now, Red Robin and Lazy Dog Cafe.

Went here on a Friday night with a party of 10. We ordered appetizers and I would highly suggest the macaroni cheese bites. The service was ok, we had to ask for drink refills. We then ordered cheesecake which was awesome. Couldn't go 5 stars due to service but food was great.

I think we all know that the food at The Cheesecake Factory is awesome but I don't get out to Thousand Oaks very often.  Why...because I don't drive!  I am one of those select few people who have epilepsy and navigate through Los Angeles without a car and the support of friends.  This was a special occasion because my friend and I were out there to see another friend in a local play.  We had amazing food and service from the Cheesecake Factory...they got us out in time to get to the play in time and we can tell... all the staff handled the busy restaurant with great skill. Well wouldn't you know it I left my credit card at the restaurant!  Stupid me.  I called into the restaurant and they were really awesome.  I never told them that I couldn't get there because of my condition just that I couldn't get back there and was pretty far away.  They offered to mail me my card.  They were totally sweet.  If you are in the area...go!  They will take great care of you!
This place can't even make a salad.

The only other Cheesecake Factory I've been too prior to this visit is in S.F. @ Union Sq. I had a decent experience, so when I saw there was one in Thousand Oaks I thought well okay then.  The menu is very extensive!! Especially if unsure of what you're in the mood for. Seems like they offer something for every taste, which is good. I couldn't make my mind up between a Caesar salad, pizza, burger, or sandwich. After some deep deliberation I opted for the Turkey Club. I've had better, but it wasn't bad. Fries came in a cute bucket. Lol!  Hubby ordered the Blackened Chicken sandwich. That too was just okay ( had a bite to check it out ). Again I've had better at other restaurants, but it was okay.  Our server was super friendly, came to see if we were okay frequently. Food came out to us hot and fast. Iced tea glasses were filled often, and it was all done with a smile.  I will probably come back to the Factory again...I would like to try the Chicken Caesar salad. For me, the frequency of my visits teeter on the deliciousness of their Ceasar salads...so we'll see.  Keeping you posted Yelpers. :-).

Why do I adore Cheesecake Factory so? I think its this, I know I'm going to like whatever I order and I will consistently be pleased when I eat here. I like the iced tea, the bread, the cocktails, the salads, and the entrees. However, appetizers are my favorite food, and CF has a larger, more adventurous selection of apps than anybody else. On this particular visit I enjoyed a small salad, chicken samosas, and shrimp and grits, all on the "small bites" menu, all delicious. No room for dessert this visit.

I took my mother for Mother's Day here we had the worst type of service. We asked to have a piña colada remade since it tasted more like a vanilla shake we were asked to pay more for a defective drink and the waiter simply dumped food on the table and ignored us. Willfully ignored us. Never coming back. The restaurant right across them has superior service.

Good food but bad service. We went here for a work bday celebration and made a reservation at 1130.  2 1/2 hours later we were out. It wasn't a large group so we were surprised it took so long, especially because we beat the lunch rush when we put our order in. Wouldn't suggest coming here with a big group unless you have time to wait.
Consistently on top of their game. Always great food with service to match!
Things to try:  Miso Salmon, Crusted Chicken Romano, Pecan Crusted Catfish and the red velvet cheesecake!  I want all of these things every day

The empire of cheesecakes. Well, you know what, I can't really hate on you. Why? You have fairly decent food at reasonable prices. Plus, you're open late.  It's always fun to eat at this Cheesecake Factory as you see all the inspiring "Real Wives Of O.C." here. I'm actually quite shocked that show wasn't made out here considering a lot of the people in this county really think they're special because they have money.  Anyways, always decent food, service is always good. If you haven't been to Cheesecake Factory in your life, you must live under a rock.

This Cheesecake is actually at the Thousand Oaks Mall!!  Took me a good while to figure that out - I kept yelling at my Navi as to why it kept leading me to the mall. Sat outside on the patio with a few friends and just hung out and talked for the longest time.  The server was very nice and never gave us the feeling that we needed to leave.  We had a slow lunch and took our time. Great attitude by everyone there!

Came into dine here this past weekend, and just had an okay experience. Waitress was slow food was alright nothing special. The atmosphere was very loud. The best part of the meal was their delicious classic cheesecake to finish it off.

Bad front seating customer service! we came in and stood there for a couple minutes...there was about 4 employees standing around..and someone that might of been the manager ..and we were not greeted or asked anything at all..out of all those people no one said anything to us..some random lady came and Sat us ..they were too concerned to get there stuff done and it was only 40 min. Till closing time..they need to work on there front seating customer service..this kinda stuff makes u just wanna walk back out and just go somewhere else.

My food and service was so good last week at the Cheesecake Factory in Sherman Oaks and I had a specialty dish that was worth having again so we popped in to the Thousand Oaks Cheesecake for a redux. The portion was smaller next to the Sherman Oaks Cheesecake and there service was all backwards. We waited 20 minutes before they even asked if we wanted bread and water. When the Enchiladas came there was a tablespoon of Cilantro Rice on the plate. They made it up by bringing a side dish but it was not as good as the week before.  We will have to try Woodland Hills before they change the specialty menu again!

Cum-on, who doesn't luv the Cheesecake Factory.  I mean they are good, but not great. You can always get a great fill on what ever dish you order.  We always eat up at the bar (also quicker service / less of a wait) and socialize with the Bartenders.  Recommend just getting an appetizer & entree to share between two. I love desserts, but most of the time we take a pass.  Super casual & laid back place.

Make sure to check the Hawaiian pizza for tooth pick pieces! My sisters mouth almost got cut up! But thankfully the manager took off our bill and the company apologized with a gift card. The waitress wasn't the friendliest but we still love the cheesecake! Waitress attitude and the toothpicks in the pizza is the reason I lowered my star ranking
This cheesecake factory is nothing like the one in Albuquerque New Mexico !!!  Love love love it ! Upside down pineapple cheesecake is simply divine ;)

I used to LOVE the Cheesecake Factory (for a chain, it's good, what can I say?) but I guess as with most things, you get bored after awhile.   Yeah, their food is decent and they have HUGE portions but really?  Does America NEED to eat a plate of food large enough to feed 3-4 people?   That being said, I love the Baja Chicken Tacos, the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes, the Santa Fe Salad, the Chicken & Biscuits, the Steak Diane and the Morning Quesadilla.

This is a family favorite and you really can't go wrong. Aside from the obvious cheesecake menu (which is extensive), the menu is several pages and chock full of good stuff. For myself, I am a fan of the Sheppards Pie and the blackened chicken pasta. The pot stickers are always good. The only bad thing about this location is the wait. You can bet on 30 minutes to an hour wait.

This place is a nightmare ! Besides the fact that they make you wait at least 1 hour even on week days , the floors are so slippery I almost fell down 2 times. The food is good of course like at every other Cheesecake Factory but this location is terrible . The services is always rude and can't wait to get you out of there fast enough... If you can choose between going to this branch or the one in canoga , then definitely the one on Canoga would be my choice!

If I could rate my experience on Friday lower I would! I was having lunch with my sister and a friend. I ordered the luau salad, it comes with 2 large wonton crisps on it. As I took a bite I thought I got a big piece of the crisp and started to chew,it felt odd so I took it out of my mouth only to discover it was a large chunk of GLASS!! Our waitress came over immediately and apologized and told us there was nothing she could say to excuse the glass and she took it away. The manager then came over and got all of my info and said someone would be calling me. They offered me a different meal and I said no I was to scared as I just poked my lower jaw with a piece of glass. My meal was taken off the bill, the other two girls had leftovers and didn't want to bring them home and risk getting glass in their food. I've been come to this restaurant a handful of times and it's been ok. But having glass in my food is inexcusable.

This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory location. I always receive excellent customer service, even when the restaurant is extremely crowded. My favorite items on the menu are the Macaroni and Cheese Burger and Red Velvet Cheesecake. I come here with my boyfriend for virtually every special occasion and couldn't be happier.

Ordered catering for an office lunch last week. Specifically asked the manager what the dimensions of the catering pans were and how many pans per entree, etc. I told him we were feeding 25 ppl and he assured me that the order we placed would feed up to 32 ppl. I then gave him the credit card information to run the order. When the order was being picked up the person helping us said he never ran the credit card. It's a corporate card so we had left it at the office. Had to call the office and give the card number again. Now we're running late for the lunch and by the time we got back and set everything up it was 15 minutes past the scheduled lunch time. We also realized then that in spite of the reassurances about the amount of food, we weren't going to have enough!! One of the entrees we ordered was fettuccine alfredo with chicken. It came in 2 small pans that were only filled an inch high even though the pans were over 3 inches high. There were maybe 10 pieces of chicken in each pan. The fettuccine dish alone cost $80!!!  I even called the manager back and told her we weren't going to have enough food and that the pans weren't even full and she just said we can order, pay for and then pick up more food. Um, no thank you, never again.  Way over priced for what you actually get!!!!

Service here can be absolutely terrible or quite good.  It is a crap shoot.  Today, it was the latter.  My girlfriend wanted to have the Bang Bang Chicken that many are raving about.  It was not on the menu.  You have to ask for it.  I tried some of her dish and both of us wondered what was the big deal.  It wasn't that great.  The sauce was a peanut/curry(?)  blend and was way too sweet. I had the Baja Chicken Hash.  Outside of the fact that the eggs were raw and runny (egg white was not cooked), it was pretty good.  I think the eggs were supposed to be poached, but was not. I am not sure exactly why we continue to go there, as we did not even have a slice of cheesecake.  Oh yeah, the not so good coffee was $3.00.   I think I will try to find another Sunday brunch establishment.

*** This review is for my experience ordering cakes only -  not for the restaurant *** After a couple years of ordering birthday cakes almost exclusively from Nothing Bundt Cakes, I decided to mix it up a little.  My older son asked for a cheesecake for his birthday, so I came here.  The cake was delicious,and the service was great.  So when my younger son asked for a red velvet cheesecake for his birthday a couple months later, I came back here.  The difference this time, is it was 5 days before Christmas . . . at The Oaks Mall.  After circling the parking lot for about 10 minutes, I finally found a space and entered the extremely busy restaurant.  Again, great customer service.  I ordered and paid for my cake but I couldn't wait for them to write on it, so when I returned 20 minutes later, I parked in the pick-up lane and was in and out of there in about a minute - at Christmastime - at The Oaks Mall!  The cake was delicious, and I am very happy with my experiences here.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a fun place to eat at.  They have lots of variety and I've been pleased with the quality of the service and food.  I DID enjoy the Seared Tuna Tataki Salad most recently but used to use the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp as my go to menu item.  It can get quite busy, but they manage to staff themselves appropriately so that the wait that you experience as a seated customer is not offensive.  I appreciate that.
It's take a long time for the food to arrive although the food is very tasty. Recommend you to try the salmon miso. Is it delicious.

all i can say is that service is so bad.. we were here yesterday and we just walked out. They sat us down in a table gave my daughter a piece of bread and slice banana and never came back. i called of the server he said he will call our waiter and no one came. so we just decided to leave. What's the point of making fight or agrument. SO DISAPPOINTED. I DONT EVER WANT TO COME BACK AND I WILL NEVER SUGGEST THEM TO ANYONE I KNOW.
So happy I get to pay $17 for 2 slices of cheese cake Togo and it takes 15minutes. Best part is you get all the attitude from everyone who works here. Last.time.ever.

Went for dinner with my family. The food was amazing. I had the Diane steak so did my husband just done perfectly. Our daughter got the pesto pasta and added some shrimp as well and really enjoyed it. The reason for the three stars is the service. Waiting to be seated to a long time and for no apparent reason. The food took a while to come as will, other than that I would say over all a great evening

Love, love this place.  The food is always perfection, the atmosphere is inviting and romantic.  The salmon is the best I have ever had and there chocolate cake is amazing.   Sometimes you have a long wait, but it usually goes pretty fast.  They will give you a pager, so you can shop around.  Not a huge fan of malls, but better than being bored. The hostess who sat us was really sweet (Chrissy?) and our waiter Joel  was incredible.  He took the time to talk to us and help us order for our children.  He was super fast and very efficient!   We love this place and eat there several times a year. Go!!!!

There was a time they cared. Waited a half hour for a to go order that when I was told would take 15 minutes. Got a half assed apology. Now I'm not surprised by the poor rating. The hostess was nice and I realize it's not her fault. Plus I saw a couple cheesecakes kept on top of the counter unrefrigerated during the time I waited.

Let me share my upsetting experience. The receptionist told me it would be 45 minutes. Well, we waited an hour. Then I came up to the receptionist again and told her I waited longer than what she told me and that my daughter is now crying and hungry. Then they took us in. Let's talk about the service -very bad. We got cold bread. They usually serve white and brown rolls. This time they only served us the white bread slices. Although I see the servers delivering white and brown bread slices to other tables. We barely saw our server. Over all, it was a shitty experience. Oh yeah, did I mention we came here after my daughter's recital? Her happiness and proud moment concluded with a very upsetting dinner.

As usual, it was PACKED.  Had a 40 minute wait (Friday night, so understandable.) Right at 40 minutes we were seated.  Had a great waiter named Kyle who was polite, efficient and responsive. Food was fantastic.  (I had the spicy chicken.. very good.)  Huge portions; expect a to-go box. Overall a great experience!
Always a great choice, but so darn busy that it is hard to get a table after work.  Not a bad thing since no one wants to eat in an empty restaurant.

Love love love this place '! This is my go too for any occasion, whether a birthday, graduation, or just a family dinner. The service we receive is always splendid. The people here are so friendly and do anything in thier power to give great customer service. I went last night for my moms birthday and it was a great dinner. I got the tomatoe basil pasta which was delicious. And the warm bread is just spectacular ! For desert I got a Godiva chocolate cheesecake and it was perfection in every single bite. To top off our night three employees including our awesome server came along with a little dessert to song happy birthday to my mom. What a wonderful dinner and a wonderful experience. That's why I always come back! Good job guys !(:

This is a chain but I always have great food here.  Our waitress was very nice, she gave good suggestions and our drinks were never empty.  This isn't the biggest Cheesecake Factory I have been to but it is nice.  They have an "outdoor" sitting area, which is really inside but it's nice.  Our food came fast and warm.  I really liked the Sunday brunch.

We have been to several cheesecake factories. This one is run pretty well.  The Good: service is good. Dinner portions are huge so good for sharing. I order off the skinnylicious to save the calories.  The Bad: there is limited parking here at the mall Tip: we like bringing the banana cream pie cheesecake and freezing it. It taste amazing once frozen

I love cheesecake. Love this location because it's at the TO mall which is becoming my favorite since moving from the valley to Simi. My boyfriend and I noticed that all the same employees have been there forever so that means the management much be good and that they are good workers as well. I have to say Domingo is my favorite waiter though, such a nice guy! Can't go wrong with Cheesecake.

I'm never disappointed with the food served here! The dishes always taste amazing and of course the desserts are to die for. However, tonight's trip  was a little irritating! We arrived around 7 pm( Friday) night and were told it would be a 50minute wait- we didn't get seated until 8:15! Our server was extremely short with us and only checked on us 2x. I understand that Friday nights are busy- but I still expect to be treated with excellent service despite the business. If you wanna make those tips- ya better work your tables!!!! Hopefully next time our server will go above and beyond!

The Farmhouse burger rocks! I have had this burger twice since it appeared on the menu and it's one of the best burgers I've ever had. Everything at this restaraunt is great. They have something for everybody there, I highly recommend it. The only drawback to the place is the noise level. If you don't mind the noise it's very nice.

I love this place! o so good! The inside and outside is both nicely decorated. Their food portions are very big and you are def. getting your money's worth. I've never been dissappointed about my food choices, they are all good. I recommend the salads, but they are really big, the chicken marsala (yum!) and of course all the cheescakes are great. The dulce de leche cheesecake is the most sugar teeth decaying cheesecake, i swear it's tastes like pure sugar, doesn't even taste like cheesecake. The ones that are good is white chocolate raspberry truffle (OMG YUM!), snickers bar. Though I think the slices have got smaller over the years, they are still good. What might be better priced if you want a whole cheesecake is go to costco and they have the cheesecake factory sampler w/ 4, I think different kinds in each package (3 of each kind) and they are all really good. Back to the cheesecake factory: They have good service, good food portions, but...it gets soooo busy there, mostly on the weekends but even on the week nights can get pretty bad. If you can make reservations I suggest that. The shortest amount of time that I had to wait was about 30 mins. But if your lucky they have tables for you to wait at. Other than that you won't regret your decision of eating here. O and depending on what you get like pasta for example, you can split between 2 people.

The silverware and glassware were very dirty. I asked for replacements and we got silverware that still had specks of food on them and the glass had a lipstick mark on it. I finally asked for plastic silverware and glasses. If the silverware and glassware is that dirty, what does the kitchen look like? Food was fine but experience ruined for a family lunch

The food at the Cheesecake factory for the most part is always plentiful and good.  However we go there, as most do, for the cheesecake.  This is the second time in 3 months we went to the same Cheescake Factory location to celebrate one of my childs birthday.  And for the second time in a row, they blew it.  Upon checking in, I told the hostess that we were celebrating a birthday and she said she would tell the waiter.  Surprise for the second time in a row, the hostess forgot.  I can care less about a free dessert, but most kids like to feel special on the birthday, so a candle and some recognition is always nice.  The fact that it has happened twice in a row with two seperate hostess', means that this is a management issue.  While I brought it to the managers attention, and she agreed and apologized, the incident left a bad taste in my mouth.  For me good service always trumps all.  Very dissapointing.

I work in this mall and its easy to get very sick of the food choices we have... it can also get pricey!  I love when my 'lunchtime' at work falls between 4 and 7 pm so that I can enjoy Cheesecake's happy hour!  Honestly, if you can find something on the happy hour menu then Cheesecake Factory is the cheapest meal in the mall!!  Otherwise the menu is HUGE so if cash is not your concern then Cheesecake Factory is also a place that you can enjoy regularly without getting sick of it, so many choices!!!  The 'to go' gals are always sweet and at least remember my face whenever I come.  Recently this location redecorated their little patio area (well, they have an outdoor patio but then they have this little atrium like area that is actually inside the mall but not in the restaurant main) So technically they redecorated the atrium area and it looks so much nicer!  I'd still prefer to sit in the restaurant main or out on the actual patio (on a nice day) but if it's busy and I get placed out there now I'd feel comfortable. The last time I went for dinner (outside of a work break) was for my 2 year anniversary with my boyfriend and the waitress was so sweet and even had our dessert made special for us!  Yeah, I'm a fan of Cheesecake Factory, but particularly this location!

Few of us decided to dine on Tuesday because of their mushroom soup is only served on Tuesday (dumb idea) and 1/2 off cheesecake once a year on Tuesday. Our order took over 30 mins to get (waiter put our order in late) and the food was sent back because it was overcooked (just had bread that night) and the service was poor. Oh by the way now the mushroom soup is only served on Wednesdays. Not that we will return.

Omg I love Cheesecake factory, the price is decent and the food is great.  I always get the Cajun chicken little's or the Thai lettuce wraps it's soooo good. They have a lot of choices of foods & drinks. The only thing i dislike about cheesecake factory is that is so dark, they really need to turn up the lights lol. Other than that it's a really great place to eat or go on a date. Oh I almost forgot, they have the best free bread ever.

had dinner with a couple of friends the other night and was very pleased with the dining experience.  The food was good for a chain restaurant and loved all the options.  we started with the avocado egg rolls which were awesome, and for an entree i went with the miso salmon which i would definitely recommend.  Last but not least you cant go to The Cheesecake Factory without indulging with a little dessert...we went with the dutch apple cheesecake and it was frieken delicious!  I've eaten at cheesecake many times before and like I said the food is really good for being a chain restaurant, but what I would come back for without a doubt was the amazing service!!  Our server was Megan G and even though the restaurant seemed to be busy at the time she was extremely attentive.  She seemed to be very knowledgeable and did everything in a timely manor (the food did take a while, but that's expected in a busy restaurant).  In addition a manager had stopped by to check up on us and made sure we were enjoying our meal.  A glass was never left empty and the food came out hot (except the cheesecake of course).   Being a server myself I know it is not easy to keep up with the guests needs when the restaurant is busy, great job to Megan and the entire wait staff at Cheesecake.  I will be back and look forward to another great dining experience.

Everyone knows Cheesecake.  It's predictable, reasonable, and filling.  It's the place to go when you don't want to take chances and you like the buzz of people enjoying the food. Hubby and I enjoy splitting a salad and getting the tuna sushi appetizer.  I like Cheescake and you probably do too.

The Godiva chocolate cheese cake is awesome! Service is always good. I am not a big fan of chain restaurants but I admit the food is good and big enough to share. We had lunch and shared the Barbecue Chicken Ranch Salad, it was a great choice for lunch.  I had a Stella on tap at $6.00 a glass 16 oz that seems a little pricey. It's good but yes it is a chain restaurant.
You can never go wrong with this place. Anything on the menu is delicious and tasty. I tried the steak Dian for the first time and highly recommend it!

I went to the Cheesecake Factory for the cheesecake. I did eat a main entree, some pasta thing w/ chicken and shrimp. Very good by the way, but the Banana Cream Cheesecake was the best combination of cheesecake, whipped cream, and fresh banana's I've ever tasted. My hubby said the whipped cream was like eating a fluffy cloud.  Don't know when he tasted a cloud, must of been before we started dating.   We did not have to wait to be seated which was a relief. We had to walk this long courtyard in pouring rain to find the place. The server was very handsome and we got our food quick.   We had leftovers from our main entrees but we devoured that cheesecake slice even licked the plate clean. Hee hee those snobby people a table away probably assumed we were Oxnardians.   Anyhoo, we will defenitley be repeat customers, but only on special occasions because I believe their prices are up there.

Ate here on numerous occasions during my employment in Boring Oaks.. I mean Thousand Oaks. I always had excellent service and very friendly staff despite it being empty or filled at 100% capacity.  These guys never missed a beat.  Food portions were massive and always took food home. Each time the food was delicious and excellent. I LOVED the pulled pork sandwich despite the food coma after ahha..  Bar service is excellent even during 5pm happy hour.

As Cheesecake Factory chain goes, this one is OK. It has a variety of menu options and is a general good choice if you're feeling fo-adventurous. I am a fan of the eggplant burger, the yummiest veggie burger in town.  If you are on a wheel chair though, I recommend eating off peak hours because the tables are too close for easy navigation during rush hours.

My last visit to Cheesecake Factory in Thousand Oaks was the worst dining and service experience I have ever had. I mention Thousand Oaks because I frequent the Sherman Oaks location and have always had a good experience. I am a pretty understanding person and being that I work in the service industry, can relate;however, the only explanation I have is that I was discriminated against. This experience has forever changed my perception of the company and I will never return but I believe it's my duty to share it with you. After arriving and being informed of a "15" min wait time, I was seated after 1hr15min, only because I surfaced my concern as I witnessed 4-5 groups of all sizes that arrived after me get seated first. I even stood by the greeter after she told me I was next. After another 2 groups were seated I looked at the greeter and she said it was okay and assured me my table was being prepared. Another 2 groups were seated and the greeter tells me my she is sorry but my table was given away. I hope you can understand my frustration and dismay. I am a  male Hispanic with 2 female Hispanics, celebrating a birthday after work. We are well dressed and I can't find another reason or explanation. I don't think competence could have taken it this far.  Finally we were seated at a what seemed to be a remote location within the Resturant that was almost empty(4-5 empty tables). The server wasn't much better than the greeter( drinks were never refilled). Anyways, this experience has taken enough of my time but I truly hope others don't have to share this same experience, drive to Sherman Oaks. It's only 35-40 min away(without traffic) but if you are Hispanic, you might be saving time.

I won't reiterate the menu here, it's Cheesecake Factory. Food is average,  service is absolutely horrible. Staffed primarily by snotty teens from the area, unless you meet their visual standards then prepare to wait and be treated poorly. Since I'm a little on the bigger side, I think you can tell where this is going. The couple of times I've been to this location the food has been OK but it takes so long to get out to you, you start to wonder if it's even worth it (even on several slow weekdays my wife and I have been subject to excessively long waits), in addition we've had trouble with our servers being given too large an area to service and having to wait for far too long for drink/bread refills. Even the CHEESECAKE here isn't that great. Heresy, you might say, but I've had better, and more often.  My suggestion: try Sisley across the way, they (used to?) have a wicked italian saugage with fettucine, the staff is much friendlier and the wait far shorter.

So many, many lunches with mom and my little brother have been spent here.  Right after sweet talking her into buying me a pair of shoes or something because this location is located in the Thousand Oaks mall.  The waits are never terrible, and the service is always great! P.S.  Why are the floors at EVERY C.F. so gosh darn slippery!  Why?

Even though it's a chain, cheesecake factory is pretty good.  Consistent from location to location.  For steak lovers, the cajun ribeye is really good - far better than steakhouses like outback. The low-carb cheesecake is fantastic.

I've been impressed with all the dishes here.  We enjoyed the arugula pear endive salad, chinese chicken salad, grilled eggplant sandwich, herb crusted salmon filet, cajun jambalaya pasta, crispy spicy beef, meatloaf, shrimp scampi with steak diane, filet mignon, kobe burger, chicken madeira, all the apps are great!  Good beverage selection, good well drinks, good martinis, everything here is good! The point, all portions are good enough for two people, so try splitting an entree.  Otherwise this always an excellent choice for lunch or dinner.

Always good food and great service.  I honestly have been here more times than I can count and have never had even mediocre service.  It is always great or excellent.  They have it together.  And try their mai tais!  They are crazy strong and good.  As for complaining about a long wait, booo hoo, get there early or come late.  There is a reason they are popular, and like all popular restaurants you WILL have to wait.
Santa Fe Salad, what a meal, I enjoyed eating at the cheesecake factory and I certainly enjoyed the strawberry cheesecake. A great place for a lunch date with friends.
Great service! Great food! Great atmosphere! Great CHEESECAKE! and Great management! Kudos!

Dude its the Cheesecake factory!  Its the same everywhere you go.  Um except this was the location where some employees were stealing credit card information.  It was all over the news.  Anyway to the food.  They have lots of variety but the food is usually mediocore to good.  Never poor, never great.  I did try something new this time around.  Miso glazed salmon.  Not bad at all.  Glad I did not pick up the tab with my credit card though.

I have been to the Cheesecake Factory at the Grove several times and the food was always consistently good.  Not great by any means but OK.  I went to this location last night and was pretty disappointed.  I ordered a small endive and pecan salad and a grilled cheese.  When the salad arrived, I noticed something strange in it and it was a big hunk of chicken.  Now being a vegetarian for 17 years, I wasn't actually sure what it was but Paul tasted it and confirmed that it was indeed chicken....bummer. So, I sent it back right away and didn't ask for a replacement.  Paul had ordered the garlic noodles without cheese and had to send his back because it came with the cheese.  He also mentioned that he didn't like how it tasted so he ordered the Kobe burger as a replacement.  My grilled cheese was actually burnt and gross.  The cheddar cheese was actually brown and did not taste like any type of cheddar I have ever had before.  Sigh....I only ate about four bites.   The manager came over and apologized profusely for the problems with our food which was nice.  I was too embarrassed to send the grilled cheese back too, I am not used to sending food back.  Everyone else liked their food so, maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.  (Although I have ordered this same thing at the Grove location before and it was good enough!). The desserts at the Cheesecake factory are awesome though.  I tried a few bites out of Paul's Godiva brownie ice cream sunday and out of my brother in law's peanut butter cookie dough  cheese cake and wow....they were both fantastic.  They also brought us a mini ice cream Sunday for a birthday celebration and that was good also.   Although my food stunk and Paul had to send his back the first time I had a nice time.  The outside patio area is decorated nicely and the waitstaff are quite friendly.  Everyone else that were with loved their food and the desserts are amazing.  Normally I would have given the Grove location a three star rating but for this location I am actually giving it a 1.5-2 star rating.  Hey, but the leftover pizza that I ate as soon as I got home from Buono was AWESOME!

I love the cheesecake factory. Consistent, well trained staff and huge portions. Not to mention other variety of food choices. It is a little overwhelming bout since i'm a picky eater it's not that bad.  Favorites: fried Mac and cheese balls for appetizers, ALL the pastas. Wow i could go on forever. If you have the opportunity request Dan as your server.  Excellent every time. But don't go on a Friday night cuz you will wait forever!! Stick with lunch or weekdays.

if there could be one word to describe the cheesecake factory...it would probably be "massive quantity"...wait, i said one, right? after spending what little funds i had in my checking account in order to put glee on the faces of each of my nieces & nephews for the xmas holiday...my shopping posse decided to round up and eat at this establishment. after drinks were served all 'round (i had a mint iced tea...i was feeling kinda sissy-ish)...our dishes were served not too long after. the quesadilla i ordered was filling as always...the pico de gallo and guacamole is always good to smother over my quesadilla.  a few other plates that floated around the table were pork chops, some steak dishes, and my sis's favourite, the pizza lunch order.  it came w/ a caesar's salad.  my sis had a "collection plate" in front of her order....which meant that she wanted everyone to place a taste of their order in there so she could try it...she's a funny girl. so this place, like many other restaurant chains, has it's charms...the outdoor heated seating (cuz it's been a bit chilly lately), the waiters asking if you want freshly ground peppery, or freshly shaved parmesan cheese...it's all good, and so were our meals. a solid four stars cheesecake!  and again, that mint tea is ace!

The Cheesecake Factory serves a large variety of consistently good food.  It's a great place to eat after shopping at the mall. It's also a good place to take a group as someone usually finds something they like.  I like their salmon salad. Don't hate me, but I think their cheesecake (though large in variety) is just OK.

Why the hell would you spend 50 to 75 for a meal for two at the Cheesecake Factory when you could actually find a good local restaurant on Yelp that has much better food.  Some previous reviews have said that there is something for everyone, but that is part of the problem with the place.  I am sorry but I do not need to have a large variety of mediocre food.  If I want thai food or Italian food, I will go to a restaurant that actually specializes and does it well, instead of getting the Bang Bang Bangkok Brothel dish or whatever the hell it is called.  My final beef is with the menus.  I do not want to see a Lexus ad next to my food selections.  I really wonder about a chain that feels the need to squeeze out as much profit as possible by selling the real estate of their menus.  But maybe that is how they support the cost of their massive portions?  If your friends drag you here, then do not fret too much, but otherwise be a true Yelper and choose restaurants that do one cuisine well.

hands down my favorite go to restaurant. when we can't decided where to grab a bite or wake up starving sunday morning and don't want to drive too far this is where we end up. the service is always great. they now offer kids menus which we don't order from anyways though. and they have a great green iced tea. i get mine sweetened and it is heaven, it has a minty taste which i love. i always love what i order, like the miso salmon, garlic noodles with shrimp, tuna tar tar, farfalle, pizzas. i love it all.

OMG, let me just tell you that this place is soooo good and I am know the biggest fan of Cheesecake factory.  Unfortunately, the resturant is unable to reach five star quality due to the fact that it takes two hours to get a table and the table that we received was smooshed into a corner on the patio.  Did I mention that we were a party of 10???!!!???  Oh yea, lets not forget that our party was making the table of two next to us upset cause we were bumping into them for the mere fact that we were trying to get to our seats....**end rant** Now to the food, I had the best appetizer and side salad, and let me tell you that i was just the right size for me as the meal portions here are huge and I really did not want a huge heavy meal, I really wanted cheesecake and I did not want to feel guilty for eating.  I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna with a simple salad with Honey Mustard.  I would recommend this dish combo to any who does not want a really heavy meal like lets say like my fiance who ordered the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken, now that is heavy stuff.  After dinner we ordered a the mudslide Oreo cheesecake.  It was way yummy!!!! not rich even though my fiance thought it was, I did not!!!!  This is my new favorite spot it is so my favorite spot that Mark and I are going to do our date night at the brea location.  Oh how I can't wait, my mouth is watering just thinking about it!!!! Yummy!!!

ok so this is like the home depot of restaurants, that being said i have almost never had the cheesecke here, i am always too full for dessert, when you go please get the miso salmon its my favorite but i suggest substituting the rice for mashed  potatoes, its a zillion times better, the food is good but i gotta give them 4 stars becuase after having been here alot more times than i care to admit the service has always exceeded my expectations. i have been to these establishments in many cities and while the t.o. location is my favorite, the service at every stop has been really great

What's the point in buzzing you to let you know your table is ready if you are buzzed with 3 other parties at the same time and then ushered to the side to wait an additional 5 minutes?  Why can't you just buzz me after you seat the people in front of me and are ready to seat me?   Why do you stack all the dirty plates right in front of me before taking them away?  Why do you drop off my food and then I never hear back from you?  Why do you put so many rice noodles on your Chinese Chicken Salad?  Why do you charge a fortune for food that is so-so?  Why did you change your Baja Soft Tacos so they don't have grilled onions on them?  And why would you not tell people that it has been changed when they order it and it has the old description on the menu?  Why do you have to make cheesecakes with everything you can imagine?  Why do I keep going back?  Because the Thai Chicken Pasta is the only yummy thing I like there except when you put the carrots in it.  Why do you need carrots?

Their cheesecake is soooooooo......yummy!  Garlic noodle is my favorite!  Expect a little wait time on the weekends, but since it's located inside The Oaks mall, it's nice to look around while you wait to be seated.  I'll bet The Oaks Mall will be super nice when the renovation is done (Fall 2008).
awesome food, servers.  can get noisy in main dining but side room and also outside dining available.

My husbands meal had a 2" piece of cardboard in it.. Do they unwrap food from a package and warm it up? If so part of it ended up in his food. Our server alerted the manager who seemed annoyed at having to address an issue rather than walk around. We really didn't want to have any reason to complain since the other patrons on either side of us seemed to have several complaints.. We kept our order simple but this was unavoidable.
Excellent service and good food! I recommend the Chicken Bellagio. But their cheesecakes are too sweets!

Much smaller than many other Cheesecake Factories so the wait can get out of control sometimes especially on the weekends but they are pretty good about giving you an accurate quote time. The food like all Cheesecake Factories is superb! The fresh grade "A" ingredients they use make a great meal. Food is always hot and fresh and huge portions; definitely you get your money's worth. Out of all American chain restaurants The Cheesecake Factory is the best. The staff here is friendly clean and full of cool interesting people to spark up a conversation with. It is a little loud inside though so I would recommend sitting in the patio or the atrium. Recommended dishes and appetizers: Chicken Marcel Blanc Four Cheese Pasta Anything on the Sunday Brunch Menu (Sundays 10am-2pm) Avocado Egg rolls Sweetcorn Tamale Cakes Recommended desserts: Dulce de Leche Cheesecake Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake Adams Peanut Butter Cheesecake

Food is excellent here! I'm just not sure why the service isn't better :( I am a manager of a local restaurant myself so when I go out to eat I pray for a great server so I can leave them a nice 30% tip because I know how the industry is. Unfortunately our server was terrible. Not sure what her name was, tall girl, black hair who could care less about her job. Didn't introduce herself, didn't ask how we were doing, did not ask us if we had any questions about the menu and only checked on us once. I still gave her a 20% tip because that's just how I am. It's a shame because I love the Cheesecake Factory, but next time I go out to eat I will still to Wood Ranch or Lure Fish House because they clearly pride themselves on superior service, as do I.

I love Cheesecake Factory! So many different food options that would satisfy anyone's palate. Great service as well, but usually packed with people. Lastly the food portions are generally large so bring your appetite.

Cheesecake Factory is a usual haunt for me because of its consistency of good dishes. This location has mediocre service. Most of the waiters and waitresses always seem to be flustered or in a bad mood here. Although, if your able to pick a waiter, pick a man the name of Joel, he's one of the best waiters I've had at any place. I don't do anything on the menu except for the pastas and appetizers. Their pastas are some of the best around as well as the appetizers. Dish Recommendation: Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic (probably the best dish on the 50 page menu)

There was a 40-minute wait for "first available" on a Friday night, so we walked around the mall for a while until our buzzer went off.  We were guided (by a new host who smelled like he had just smoked a pack of cigarettes outside before his shift) to our seat, which was right by the patio door.  The table for 2 was really only big enough for 1 and as people went in and out to the patio, I froze the entire time while eating my dinner.  I ordered the meatloaf, which was good; had a sweet taste, maybe the carrots??  It was good, but not MY meatloaf!  Hubbie got the shepherd's pie which was astounding!  Yummm...   Oversized portions led us to take home an entire meal for the next day.

Cheesecake Factory never fails went there today for my birthday!!! The service was excellent but tonight the food was not as grand ;"( ... Even so I will not give up on CcF..of course the desert is always pleasing
Good variety on menu.  Food is dependable at any of their restaurant.
Good family restaurant. Food is good and service is attentive. I always opt for the 'lite' menu. We eat here about once a month. Always a line. Definitely a step above Olive Garden ...

The Cheesecake Factory has been great every time we go. We average a 15 minute wait Thursday/Friday evenings. Love the Factory Nachos or Fried Zucchini. I recommend the Chicken Katsu, Americana Burger, and any  Cheesecake! I recommend not sitting in the atrium as it can be a little noisy. Very romantic inside and great service always.

I decided to do curbside pick up this evening for dinner. The wait was over 45 minutes and my food was cold really? Come on Cheesecake Factory get it together I don't care if you're busy inside if you tell me to pick up my food in 45 minutes and I'm there to pick it up don't make me wait another 45 minutes geez!!!

Restaurants with large menus are not my thing..I'm a "mom and pop"/"hole in the wall"/or better yet..."boutique" type restaurant kinda girl. But, this fit the bill as I was meeting a friend who would be in the area. We arrived at opening and ordered off the Lunch Specials Menu. I ordered the Chicken Salad Sandwich which came with a side salad. The Chicken Salad Sandwich just tasted "off"...the chicken tasted like fish....but, I could a few more bits until I just could not stand it. Ugh. I should have told our waitstaff but I kept thinking it was me...and, honestly, it could have been. Finally, I did ask the waitstaff if I could have a sample thinking I may find that what I had been given was that a piece of fish was given instead of chicken...but, she said that all the chicken salad was already portioned out. She did offer to give me something else but I declined...had lost my appetite at that point. I honestly don't know if it was me or not...but, my stomach did feel queasy the rest of the day as well. Anyway, its a beautiful restaurant and my friend was happy with her meal. I have not had a lot of luck here in CA with Chicken Salad anyway...its best in Texas and in the South in general.

The food is always consistently good.  But service... well, I was there with my family and was definitely not impressed by the service at this location.  We were there about a little before 9 on a weekend and it felt like the staff cared more about cleaning up to go home than making sure we had bread or drinks even though they don't close until 11 or 12 on the weekends.  We spent over $200 there before tip and deserved better service than what we got.

The obvious:  best cheesecake selection in the world.  My wife likes the red velvet. Great appetizers: avocado eggrolls, corn cakes and lettuce wraps.  Great salads, sandwiches and selection of beers on tap.  Best dish according to my wife is spicy cashew chicken and she orders it with a side of thin pasta instead of white rice. I know the wait is long but get there early.  The service has usually been very good.  Just a good chain restaurant.  We usually go once a month because they have a good selection of food at a reasonable price.
Huge menu, now with a skinny menu, and gluten free menu...great options!

The quality of Food usually outpaces the customer service. It's not an indication of bad service but great food over pretty good service. I've never had an experience that I walked away from CKF saying, "this food was all right or the service ruined my delicious food." The menu can satisfy anyone with any taste given how cumbersome the food selection is. Just went on friday and noticed some bad reviews of people needlessly complaining on yelp.

My girl friend and I came and the food was amazing I loved it we were so stuffed. We got the four cheese pasta and it was amazing the sauce was really creamy. But then are server was really good his name was Shane. And he was really busy but he was able to cater to our every need!!! And was very personable. As lame as it might sound it made our time even better!!

Great service. Food looks amazing and taste amazing. Ask to sit in Joels station. He knows his menu and will take very good care of you. Very seldom these days do people take pride in their jobs. Hats off to you Joel! Tip well deserved.

We were with a large party and had to wait over 3 hours to get a table. The staff was not accommodating and kept messing up and seating other large groups before us. I love this restaurant but I was very unhappy with this specific location.

I'll never return to this place ever again. On top of an hour wait, the waitresses couldn't do simple math to figure out the tip. After 20 mins going back and forth their solution was to add more on the bill. When we brought it to their attention, their answer was that their system couldn't be changed. No refunds, no apology. Food is great, can't say the same about their service.
Always consistent and yummy, can't go wrong here...especially with their seasonal desserts, I had the peppermint bark cheesecake,check out pix
I don't think you can go wrong with your selection of food, everything is good and huge portions. Only downside is the wait

What an idiot place. It's always full, but you can't make reservations. You can only make them at 11am, 3pm and 5 pm. I called at 3.15pm - no deal. The food is OK to average, but the place is very noisy and full.  I was amazed at how costly this place is: $110 for 3 small martinis (very little vodka), one medium sized filet (very average), a small salad, and two small pieces of cheesecake. Ingredients for these are about $12. I must say that the servers were absolutely delightful, and efficient. Go elsewhere, or cook at home.

Ate here with my family (of 6) late afternoon early Saturday evening (4:50 pm) and the wait time was an average of 35-45min.  By 5:30 it was an hour!  We waited about 35 min. We sat in a booth and didn't have very much elbow room, so 2 stars there but for a very busy evening we didn't complain. 5 stars for our server Edward (also the bus boy) who was professional, upbeat & never let us see him sweat even though it was outrageously busy/slammed.  The staff seemed to help each other out which was wonderful to see. Drinks & bread served in 5 min. Appetizer: Hot Spinach & Cheese Dip 2 1/2 stars, we've had better...  It was a little bland & I wasn't crazy about the tortilla chips but my dad liked it. I had some type of Salmon dish in what tasted like a lemon-butter white wine sauce with capers & spinach plus angel hair pasta.  It was not on there usual menu.  I picked it at the very last minute & was not disappointed...absolutely delicious! 5 stars Mother-in-law had the Crispy Chicken Costoletta; Chicken Breast Lightly Breaded and Sautéed to a Crisp Golden Brown. Served with Lemon Sauce, Mashed Potatoes and it usually comes with asparagus however she subbed for green beans .  She says she really enjoyed the dish & the lemon sauce was very tasty. 5 stars   Parents had the Salisbury Chopped Steak 3 3/4 stars...my mother mentioned the steak was a bit on the fatty side which she didn't care for but they both said it still had a good taste.   Father-in-law had the Jamaican Pepper Shrimp 3 stars (wasn't spicy enough for him) but enjoyed it over-all. Husband had the pepperoni pizza...ummm yeah (I won't nag about his choice =0P), he said it was ok & really liked my salmon.  2 1/2 stars  Dessert: Chocolate Tuxedo Cream Cheesecake...looks rich but isn't!  Yum!  Decided to try this since a girlfriend of mine kept raving about it.  I really liked it (& I'm not huge on desserts) however every now & again I'll have a sweet tooth for a little something. 4 stars Cruising the mall is a great way to walk off all that food (LoL)!

The food is good and they have good deals on happy hour. The drinks are great. The cheesecake is bomb. The service is alright for the most part. The employees are very enthusiast and helpful. It's just the usual, nothing special.

I still remember the first time I stepped foot into The Cheesecake Factory. It was magical and still to this day the magic remains. I've tried almost everything on their expansive menu and have never been disappointed. This time our small group ordered the Deep Fried Macaroni and Cheese as an appetizer and I cannot begin to tell you how sinfully delicious these are. Super creamy. Extremely Macaron-ey. And the sauce they come with is an excellent complement to this already fantastic starter. If I could have just eaten a few orders of these as my entree I would have, but then I would probably be 400 pounds in no time lol. As my main course I ordered the burrito which is always prepared with the freshest ingredients and comes out piping hot. Love it. No dessert this time around even though our waiter was extremely convincing. Can't wait to try the one up here in San Jose next.

*****THE FOLLOWING REVIEW IS FOR THIS PARTICULAR LOCATION ONLY!!!!!!*****    A NOTE TO THE MANAGER IF YOU EVER READ THIS: TRY WATCHING HOW YOUR STAFF TREATS YOUR CUSTOMERS!!!! BECAUSE OTHERWISE YOU MAY LOOSE A LOT OF BUSINESS!!!!        I have been to many different locations to eat at cheese cake factory, but I would have to say this one was THE WORST!!        Its inside the thousand oaks mall, and we were sat on the patio which is part of the mall, when asked to sit inside and we told them we didn't mind waiting they said no. Our waiter was VERY arrogant, and acted as if we shouldn't have had the right to eat there (I'm assuming because we didn't know we were going to be judged on appearance, we were dressed too casually for this servers taste) so he ignored us most of the time, didn't offer us more water when our glasses were empty or more  bread when the basket was empty. Stopped in here to avoid traffic on a trip to the Central Coast. The place gets packed around 6, luckily we were seated right before the swarm of people. Service was slow, our waitress seemed like she was very tired. Food is good, I definitely recommend the skinny menu as the portions are good size and the flavor is good. Aside from our sleepy waitress, the only thing I didn't enjoy was the fact that they charge $20 for the steak diane which ended up being a plate of oversauced steak tips.
Cheese cake factory is one of my favorite places to eat! They have great food and also very good cheese cakes u should definitely try it!!!

Great!  My wife and I go at least once a week, and we love it!  There is great selection and we are always pleased.  I like the large portions.  They waiters are very professional, and we have gotten to know many of them.  Even the bus boys gladly help you.  The food arrives quickly and prepared just the way you asked--my wife often asks for substitutes for (or omissions) of  items, which they gladly do. We go to Cheesecake Factories all over the US.  We have always been pleased.  When working a long day or getting in from a late flight, they are great for late night dinners.
I really like this location because its abundance of seating.  Cheesecake factory is pretty consistent with service and menu so special consideration should be given to this location for its seating.

After hours of shopping, I usually end up at this place as it is so convenient. It's alright, but I wouldn't go out of my way just to eat here.  + The portions are so large that I can split them into 3 (and just eat that the whole day!) In the middle of the mall, perfect meeting place very roomy with abundant place chatty ambiance and nice view outside - Takes forever to get a seat Then takes forever to get the food Servers are a hit or miss  Food is overly caloric

I've always been a fan of the restaurant ever since I took my first girlfriend there for a nice romantic dinner. The skinnylicious enchiladas were amazing as always, and the waiters were sure to be there if we needed anything! The heavens must have created the oreo dream extreme chess cake, and brought it to the restaurant, beacuse I could not get enough of that Delicacy. Would definitely recommend for a nice and delicious dinner.

We went to the Cheesecake Factory last night to celebrate my daughter's 12th birthday. It was her choice and she wanted to sit in the "mall area". You can either sit in the restaurant, the outdoor patio or the seats that are in the mall. We mentioned the birthday to the hostess and she made sure that she got the details. Our server came over and immediately wished the kid a happy birthday. It was nice. Our drink order was immediately taken and the waitress handled it quickly. She also came back to take our dinner order but we were not quite ready. It seemed to take her a while to come back but they were busy. It was not absurdly long so I was OK with it. Once the orders went in, the food came out promptly. All three kids had different pasta dishes (two ordered off adult menu). My son's fettuccine Alfredo was SWIMMING in butter. I am sure it tasted OK, but I was not excited about his losing a year or two on the back end of his life. I had a burger. It was slightly cold. I was not in the mood to send anything back, so I ate it. Found out later the birthday girl's was cold also. The fries were lukewarm also. I am guessing the waitress would have taken care of it, but I did not say a word. It was my kids birthday, we were having fun and my beer was ice cold so I was willing to overlook. Because we were celebrating a birthday we got a complimentary sundae which was REALLY small. Don't count on that to share. We also ordered cheesecake (when in Rome, right?). My wife got original, son got Oreo Dream  something or other, and birthday girl got vanilla bean. Gave the sundae to the youngest. Cheesecake was amazing. The Oreo one was so rich my ten year old took home half. So 5 people (one off kid menu), one beer involved and 3 cheesecakes was 119 with tip. I didn't check but I suspect the cheesecake was a tad pricey, but it was my kids birthday. The family had fun, waitress was nice (don't know her name but I know she has a sister named Lauren who also works there). If burger and fries and pasta were warm it may have gotten a much higher grade..

Ordered to go,did curbside pick up. I love not having to go into the crowded mall, worth the $2 tip to sit in my car & text. Food came out within 2 minutes of me calling to say I was there..check your order , they forgot the bread. Luv the squaw bread...pretty expensive, $16.95 for Pasta Jambalaya or Thai Chicken Pasta.  Really liked Thai Chicken Pasta , should be on the regular menu,  not the secret menu. Oreo Extreme Cheesecake was yummers but geez $7.95 for one slice that we split between 2 adults and 1 kid. Good thing I had a gift card for the whole meal. Wish I could afford to order Cheesecake Factory to go more often.
Did a great job accommodating a large party and the food was quality.

I've never had a bad experience here!  The service is awesome.  The food is outstanding.  And they have this alcoholic pink lemonade that I have become addicted to.   I don't even like cheesecake and I like their cheesecake.  The white chocolate caramel one we had was amazing.  The avocado egg roll appetizers were too yummy.  I had the garlic pasta without the chicken and the flavor was perfect - spicy, creamy, rich. I haven't tried eating outside on their patio yet but will do so once the weather warms up again.  Cheesecake Factory is a pleaser!

This is a standard Cheescake factory. They have a small bar and great food. The Cheesecake is obviously the best in town and as it should be considering their name. This place gets real busy for dinner and the service does not slack off. They are prompt with your order and keep the place tidy.
Busy during lunch.  I really enjoy the Evelyn's Favorite Pasta.

One of my favorite places for sure!!! Staff is always awesome. Recommendations suited for you if needed (big menu). The cheesecake..... As it should be.... Is to die for. HUGE list and all of it (that I have tried) is amazing!!! Save room for sure!

It's Cheesecake factory. For the love of God people don't order something thats out of the normal. Soups, salads, sandwiches. Eat because you don't want to eat at the food court or you feel like sitting on the patio and have a over priced overrated glass of white wine. We know what we are getting when we come here.
We had an issue but the manager Jennifer came thru...Great Customer Service. Thank you

What happened?!!!! I have such fond memories of the food here but my latest experience has left me absolutely no desire to return ever...or at least not to this location. We ordered the chicken and biscuits which was advertised as sautéed chicken breasts with pan jus...what came out were 4 paper thin 2 inch x 2 inch slivers of dried out crispy (as in overcooked, not fried) pieces of chicken in a weird lemony flavored gravy. It was gross and so was the biscuit, which was also dry but strangely sweet. The entire dish had a really weird after taste and was sent back. Next up was a side of mac and cheese...usually pretty hard to mess up, unless you severely undercook the pasta and the sauce breaks...fail #2! This one sat uneaten at the edge of the table, seemingly unnoticed by the staff who never inquired as to why it was just sitting there across from us, uneaten. The third attempt was the chicken fettuccini with sundried tomatoes...this is probably thee most disgusting thing I've ever tasted...it had a really odd earthy sort of fishy flavor and despite only taking one tiny bite, I can't get that awful taste out of my mouth! After an hour and a half of sitting there waiting for something palatable to come out of the kitchen, only to be more and more disappointed each time, we finally asked for the check. Another 15 minutes went by while our server searched for the manager. The manager came over to offer us something else, just as the lights were being turned off around us. Unless he was offering a pillow and a blanket, I'm not sure what he was going to bring us...

So, not great. My wife had the Steak Diane, it was ordered med rare, came to the table VERY rare! It was seared more than cooked. My Pasta dish was the Chipoltle Chicken Pasta, should have been called the bland Chipoltle Pasta with a HINT of chicken. It had 4 small bites of chicken. The manager came over after we sent the Steak dish back and offered my wife another glass of wine, it was nice but for $70 total bill, we will not go back. Service OK, food and content, not so good!
I LOVE the 30th Anniversary Chocolate Cake Cheesecake!!! This satisfies my chocolate craving every time
Waitress - if you don't want to work - STAY HOME! Worst waitress with bad attitude I've ever experienced. You almost wanted to apologize for being her customer. Geez. Food was ok.

Not sure why our server was crying, but apparently she was having a rough night. We got taken care of though - another server took our table.  I got the "Chris' cake" and it was cold, dry, chewy and a little old tasting. I did, however, take a bite of our friend's Reeses Peanut Butter cheesecake cakey thing and THAT was incredible.

How I love the cheesecake factory!  Ive never got a bad thing here.. I love the BBQ chicken pizza, Thai lettuce wraps, roadside sliders, Thai Chicken pasta, and the nachos. Honestly, every dish here has been good.. Cheesecake: I love the 30th anniversary cheesecake.Its beyond delicious.  Favorite: Factory Mud Pie... Big slice of chocolate cake with scoops of ice cream and whip cream. Enough for 4! I get it every time I go! :)

After eating at Cheesecake factory numerous times I felt it was time to write a review.  I can honestly say there has never been a time that I've eaten at Cheesecake Factory where I haven't had a great meal.  I've tried so many different dishes and now have my favorites but all the dishes I've tried have been fresh and flavorful. The fish and chicken entrees are my personal favorites... currently the cashew chicken :)  The only problem with Cheesecake Factory, which for them has to be a great problem, at prime lunch and dinner time there is always a wait. Oh and the desserts are absolutely amazing!  I'm a whipped cream fan... they have THE BEST!!!!  Makes anything under the whipped cream that much better.

We come to this restaurant almost every Friday night.  I have never been to a restaurant that is more consistently good--both in food and service.  The staff always seems really, really happy.  Either they are tremendous fakers or Cheesecake has created a great work environment.  The service is almost better than the food just because the servers make the experience so enjoyable.   But let's be clear that the food is always great.  All of the servers are awesome and put their own twist on their service, but the 3 that we have enjoyed the most are Joel, Zack, and a nice looking tan complexion gentleman with a great deep voice.  Joel knows that menu as if he cooked it himself and is so helpful with his suggestions.   Thank you for always ending our weeks with a smile! ~Juliana and Jamey

I went to dinner here with my boyfriend tonight and overall we enjoyed our experience here. I always love their bread, especially the rye/oat bread with butter! The waiter was really nice & helpful, although he didn't really check up us after the entrees arrived, he didn't need to because the food was delish! We tried the tortilla soup special for the appetizer, which was very tasty... and I loved that it was garnished with rice and fresh cilantro! For the entrees I enjoyed a good chicken salad sandwich, the only disappointment i had was that the menu did not say celery was in it, when there was a lot of it! I don't mind celery, but I don't prefer it. My boyfriend David had the cajun chicken pasta, he liked it, and so did I! Unfortunately we were too full for a slice of cheesecake! Well be back soon!
I Love to eat here but almost every time I go there they are out my favorite plate. There excuse is that I come late at night and they always run out of it.

This location NEVER measures up to the Woodland Hills Cheesecake Factory.  I think because of being in the mall the Thousand Oaks Cheesecake Factory does not feel like they have to try too hard. They have a captive audience.  Though with more dining choices opening up at this mall they really need to get with it. It is like a good imitation of Cheesecake Factory, it just does not measure up.  I ate there yesterday.-Four Cheese Ziti Al Forno- The Pasta was so undercooked it almost cruched.  Honestly I can eat raw pasta straight from the box and get 16 ounces for .99 when its on sale. The sauce was extremely acidic leaving me with an upset stomcah the rest of the evening and into the night. I never think of going to this location for any special occassion, yet the Woodland Hills facility is my first choice. This has been the case for the Thousand Oaks Cheesecake Factory for all the years it has been opened. I give the Woodland Hlls location Five Stars, Thousand Oaks is only 2 stars.    Well worth the drive to head into the valley if you want a real Cheesecake Factory Experience.

Definitely had the worst service I've ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. Waited way too long to be greeted by the waitress, and with a restaurant so empty, there wasn't really an excuse for me. I used to be a server... so I know... Continued the evening with subpar service, the food being ok. Not the best I've had at a Cheesecake Factory, either. When the waitress finally realized she better work for her tip, she tried to be extra nice but it was a bit too little, too late. Sorry, lady. Can't force enough sweetness in the 5 minutes remaining before I sign the bill to change my opinion of the meal.

Ok...I admit it.  My wife and I are kind of clean freaks when it comes to restaurants.  And this place just isn't. On Monday my wife and I had a rare opportunity to get lunch together mid-week.  She suggested Cheesecake Factory...not my favorite anyway, but, ok.  (I think mostly she likes the place cuz she can always convince me "since we're here" why don't we do a little shopping at the mall).
